H0.text: Physical changes are the types of changes that occur when water changes from a liquid to a gas and then the steam condenses back to the liquid form.

H1.text: Chemical changes are the types of changes that occur when water changes from a liquid to a gas and then the steam condenses back to the liquid form.

H2.text: Electrical changes are the types of changes when water changes from a liquid to a gas and then the steam condenses back to the liquid form.

H3.text: Mechanical changes are the types of changes that occur when water changes from a liquid to a gas and then the steam condenses back to the liquid form.

A4.text: Many elements and some compounds change from solids to liquids and from liquids to gases when heated and the reverse when cooled.

A5.text: Physical changes are changes affecting the form of a chemical substance, but not its chemical composition.
